      # File name: README.es.md. Content: 
      `<!-- hide -->
# La Postal 
<!-- endhide -->

¬øA qui√©n no le gustan las postales? Este es uno de tus primeros ejercicios (si no es el primero) y es divertido y relativamente f√°cil :)

Vamos a crear una postal con HTML5 y CSS y luego puedes compartirla con tu madre o con tu otra mitad, ¬°ella/√©l se va a sentir orgullosa/o! :)

## üå±  ¬øC√≥mo iniciar este proyecto?

1. Asegura que ya tienes una cuenta en GitHub:  https://github.com
2. Recomendamos que abras este repositorio utilizando un entorno de desarrollo como [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/es/lesson/tutorial-de-github-codespaces) (recomendado) o [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/es/lesson/como-utilizar-gitpod). Como √∫ltima opci√≥n puedes clonar el repositorio localmente en tu computador utilizando el comando `git clone`.

Este es el repositorio que debes abrir:

```text
https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard
```

**üëâ Sigue las siguientes instrucciones sobre** [c√≥mo empezar un proyecto nuevo](https://4geeks.com/es/lesson/como-comenzar-un-proyecto-de-codificacion). Importante --> √âste repositorio no es un template.

## Instrucciones

Crea el HTML y CSS necesario para replicar [esta imagen de forma precisa](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png).

![postcard preview](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/preview.png?raw=true)

> ‚úã Aqu√≠ tienes la url del logo de 4Geeks: [http://assets.breatheco.de/apis/img/icon/4geeks.png](http://assets.breatheco.de/apis/img/icon/4geeks.png)

## Empieza por dibujar tu estrategia

![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true)

## ¬øQu√© hacer si est√°s atascado?

Hay un video sobre este ejercicio, m√≠ralo si est√°s perdido. Pero no copies todo, trata de colocar tu propio c√≥digo.

## Fundamentos
Este ejercicio cubre los siguientes fundamentos:

1. Estructura b√°sica para cada sitio web HTML5.  
2. La etiqueta *Link* para importar Reglas CSS.  
3. Uso de fuentes de google.  
3. Uso de diferentes selectores disponibles en CSS.  
4. Trabajar con contenedores o cajas: border, padding y margins.  
5. Overflow.  
6. Uso de un formulario simple.  

Este y otros ejercicios son usados para [aprender a programar](https://4geeksacademy.com/es/aprender-a-programar/aprender-a-programar-desde-cero) por parte de los alumnos de 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) realizado por [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) y muchos otros contribuyentes. Conoce m√°s sobre nuestros [Cursos de Programaci√≥n](https://4geeksacademy.com/es/curso-de-programacion-desde-cero?lang=es) para convertirte en [Full Stack Developer](https://4geeksacademy.com/es/coding-bootcamps/desarrollador-full-stack/?lang=es), o nuestro [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/es/coding-bootcamps/curso-datascience-machine-learning).
`

      # File name: README.md. Content: 
      `<!-- hide -->
# The Postcard
<!-- endhide -->

Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :)

Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :)

## üå±  How to start this project?

1. Make sure you have a Github account at:  https://github.com
2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. 

This is the repository you need to open or clone:

```text
https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard
```

**üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 


3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following:

```bash
$ learnpack start
```

## Instructions

Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png).

![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png)

> ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true)

## Create by drawing your strategy

![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true)

## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/)

1. Click on the font you like.

2. Click get font.

3. Click on Embed code.

4. Add the link tags to your html file.


## What to do if you are stuck?

There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own.

## Fundamentals
This exercise covers the following fundamentals:
1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website.  
2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules.  
3. Using google fonts.  
3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3.  
4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins.  
5. Overflow.  
6. Using a simple form.  

This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and  [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning).


`

      # File name: test.js. Content: 
      `const fs = require("fs");
const path = require("path");
const { fromFile, fromHTML } = require("../../utils/dom");
let dom = fromFile();

test("Make sure you have your index.html", function(){
    const indexExists = fs.existsSync(`./index.html`);
    expect(indexExists).toBe(true);
})

test("Make sure you created the styles.css file", function(){
    const indexExists = fs.existsSync(`./styles.css`);
    expect(indexExists).toBe(true);
})

test("Make sure your index.html contains the <link> tag", function(){
    const content = fs.readFileSync("./index.html", 'utf8')
    document.documentElement.innerHTML = content.toString();
    const linkTag = _document.querySelector("link")
    expect(linkTag).not.toBe(null);
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-header as child of .postcard", function(){
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-header')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-body as child of .postcard", function(){
    dom = fromFile();
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-body')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-footer as child of .postcard", function(){
    dom = fromFile();
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-footer')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})
`
      ---
      
      ---This is the current exercise instructions:
      # `11` Postcard Divisions

Now we have to keep building the strategy for our HTML, we have to continue dividing the postcard in pieces to be able to apply styles and control it easily.

![Postcard Divisions](../../assets/11-postcard-divisions.gif?raw=true)

## üìù Instructions:

 1. Inside your `<div class="postcard">` add three additional divs.

```txt
1. .postcard
    1.1. .postcard-header
    1.2. .postcard-body
    1.3. .postcard-footer
```
>Note: All three of them are immediate children.

## üí° Hint:

+ Please make sure the divs have the specified classes, the first of the 3 divs should have the class `postcard-header`, the second one `postcard-body` and the third one `postcard-footer`.

## üîé Important:

+ You don't have to include the dot symbol (`.`) in your class name, you will only use the dots in the CSS.

ai_interactions.ai_response:
It looks like you're on the right track with your HTML structure, but there seems to be a small issue with the placement of your divs. Can you identify where the `.postcard-header`, `.postcard-body`, and `.postcard-footer` divs should be located in relation to the `.postcard` div? 

Consider this: if the `.postcard` div is meant to be a container for those three additional divs, how should you structure your HTML to reflect that? 

Try to think about the hierarchy of your elements. What would happen if you placed the child divs inside the parent div? How would that affect the layout and styling?

      # File name: README.md. Content: 
      `<!-- hide -->
# The Postcard
<!-- endhide -->

Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :)

Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :)

## üå±  How to start this project?

1. Make sure you have a Github account at:  https://github.com
2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. 

This is the repository you need to open or clone:

```text
https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard
```

**üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 


3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following:

```bash
$ learnpack start
```

## Instructions

Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png).

![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png)

> ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true)

## Create by drawing your strategy

![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true)

## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/)

1. Click on the font you like.

2. Click get font.

3. Click on Embed code.

4. Add the link tags to your html file.


## What to do if you are stuck?

There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own.

## Fundamentals
This exercise covers the following fundamentals:
1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website.  
2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules.  
3. Using google fonts.  
3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3.  
4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins.  
5. Overflow.  
6. Using a simple form.  

This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and  [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning).

      # `11` Postcard Divisions

Now we have to keep building the strategy for our HTML, we have to continue dividing the postcard in pieces to be able to apply styles and control it easily.

![Postcard Divisions](../../assets/11-postcard-divisions.gif?raw=true)

ai_interactions.ai_response:
Let's take a moment to reflect on the structure of your HTML. You mentioned that you're unsure about how to organize the divs. 

If we think about the `.postcard` div as a box that holds other items, what would be the logical way to place the `.postcard-header`, `.postcard-body`, and `.postcard-footer` inside it? 

Consider this: What would happen if you placed those three divs outside of the `.postcard` div? How would that impact the way they are styled or displayed? 

Try to visualize the hierarchy. What do you think the correct structure should look like?

ai_interactions.student_message: Creo que como lo he hecho esta correcto. Cual es el error?

## üå±  How to start this project?

1. Make sure you have a Github account at:  https://github.com
2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. 

This is the repository you need to open or clone:

```text
https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard
```

**üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 


3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following:

```bash
$ learnpack start
```

## Instructions

Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png).

![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png)

> ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true)

## Create by drawing your strategy

![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true)

## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/)

1. Click on the font you like.

2. Click get font.

3. Click on Embed code.

4. Add the link tags to your html file.


## What to do if you are stuck?

There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own.

## Fundamentals
This exercise covers the following fundamentals:
1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website.  
2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules.  
3. Using google fonts.  
3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3.  
4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins.  
5. Overflow.  
6. Using a simple form.  

This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and  [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning).


`

      # File name: test.js. Content: 
      `const fs = require("fs");
const path = require("path");
const { fromFile, fromHTML } = require("../../utils/dom");
let dom = fromFile();

test("Make sure you have your index.html", function(){
    const indexExists = fs.existsSync(`./index.html`);
    expect(indexExists).toBe(true);
})

test("Make sure you created the styles.css file", function(){
    const indexExists = fs.existsSync(`./styles.css`);
    expect(indexExists).toBe(true);
})

test("Make sure your index.html contains the <link> tag", function(){
    const content = fs.readFileSync("./index.html", 'utf8')
    document.documentElement.innerHTML = content.toString();
    const linkTag = _document.querySelector("link")
    expect(linkTag).not.toBe(null);
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-header as child of .postcard", function(){
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-header')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-body as child of .postcard", function(){
    dom = fromFile();
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-body')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})

test("Create a div with class postcard-footer as child of .postcard", function(){
    dom = fromFile();
    const e=dom.querySelector('.postcard').inside().querySelector('.postcard-footer')
    expect(e).toBeTruthy();
})
`

      # `11` Postcard Divisions

Now we have to keep building the strategy for our HTML, we have to continue dividing the postcard in pieces to be able to apply styles and control it easily.

![Postcard Divisions](../../assets/11-postcard-divisions.gif?raw=true)

## üìù Instructions:

 1. Inside your `<div class="postcard">` add three additional divs.

```txt
1. .postcard
    1.1. .postcard-header
    1.2. .postcard-body
    1.3. .postcard-footer
```
>Note: All three of them are immediate children.

## üí° Hint:

+ Please make sure the divs have the specified classes, the first of the 3 divs should have the class `postcard-header`, the second one `postcard-body` and the third one `postcard-footer`.

## üîé Important:

+ You don't have to include the dot symbol (`.`) in your class name, you will only use the dots in the CSS.

      # File name: README.md. Content: 
      `<!-- hide -->
# The Postcard
<!-- endhide -->

Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :)

Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :)

## üå±  How to start this project?

1. Make sure you have a Github account at:  https://github.com
2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. 

This is the repository you need to open or clone:

```text
https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard
```

**üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 


3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following:

```bash
$ learnpack start
```

## Instructions

Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png).

![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png)

> ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true)

## Create by drawing your strategy

![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true)

## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/)

1. Click on the font you like.

2. Click get font.

3. Click on Embed code.

4. Add the link tags to your html file.


## What to do if you are stuck?

There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own.

## Fundamentals
This exercise covers the following fundamentals:
1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website.  
2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules.  
3. Using google fonts.  
3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3.  
4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins.  
5. Overflow.  
6. Using a simple form.  

This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and  [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning).


`

ai_interactions.ai_response:
It looks like you're on the right track with your HTML structure, but there seems to be a small issue with the placement of your divs. 

Can you identify where the `.postcard-header`, `.postcard-body`, and `.postcard-footer` divs are currently located? If we think of the `.postcard` div as a container, how should the other three divs be nested within it to ensure they are immediate children? 

Consider this analogy: if the `.postcard` is a box, the other divs should be items placed inside that box. How would you adjust your code to reflect that? 

Try to visualize how the opening and closing tags of your divs should be arranged. What changes would you make to ensure that the three divs are indeed children of the `.postcard` div?

Asegura que ya tienes una cuenta en GitHub: https://github.com 2. Recomendamos que abras este repositorio utilizando un entorno de desarrollo como [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/es/lesson/tutorial-de-github-codespaces) (recomendado) o [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/es/lesson/como-utilizar-gitpod). Como √∫ltima opci√≥n puedes clonar el repositorio localmente en tu computador utilizando el comando `git clone`. Este es el repositorio que debes abrir: ```text https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard ``` **üëâ Sigue las siguientes instrucciones sobre** [c√≥mo empezar un proyecto nuevo](https://4geeks.com/es/lesson/como-comenzar-un-proyecto-de-codificacion). Importante --> √âste repositorio no es un template. ## Instrucciones Crea el HTML y CSS necesario para replicar [esta imagen de forma precisa](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png). ![postcard preview](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/preview.png?raw=true) > ‚úã Aqu√≠ tienes la url del logo de 4Geeks: [http://assets.breatheco.de/apis/img/icon/4geeks.png](http://assets.breatheco.de/apis/img/icon/4geeks.png) ## Empieza por dibujar tu estrategia ![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true) ## ¬øQu√© hacer si est√°s atascado? Hay un video sobre este ejercicio, m√≠ralo si est√°s perdido. Pero no copies todo, trata de colocar tu propio c√≥digo. ## Fundamentos Este ejercicio cubre los siguientes fundamentos: 1. Estructura b√°sica para cada sitio web HTML5. 2. La etiqueta *Link* para importar Reglas CSS. 3. Uso de fuentes de google. 3. Uso de diferentes selectores disponibles en CSS. 4. Trabajar con contenedores o cajas: border, padding y margins. 5. Overflow. 6. Uso de un formulario simple. Este y otros ejercicios son usados para [aprender a programar](https://4geeksacademy.com/es/aprender-a-programar/aprender-a-programar-desde-cero) por parte de los alumnos de 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) realizado por [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) y muchos otros contribuyentes. Conoce m√°s sobre nuestros [Cursos de Programaci√≥n](https://4geeksacademy.com/es/curso-de-programacion-desde-cero?lang=es) para convertirte en [Full Stack Developer](https://4geeksacademy.com/es/coding-bootcamps/desarrollador-full-stack/?lang=es), o nuestro [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/es/coding-bootcamps/curso-datascience-machine-learning). ` --- --- # File name: README.md. Content: ` # The Postcard Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :) Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :) ## üå± How to start this project? 1. Make sure you have a Github account at: https://github.com 2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. This is the repository you need to open or clone: ```text https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard ``` **üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following: ```bash $ learnpack start ``` ## Instructions Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png). ![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png) > ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true) ## Create by drawing your strategy ![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true) ## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/) 1. Click on the font you like. 2. Click get font. 3. Click on Embed code. 4. Add the link tags to your html file. ## What to do if you are stuck? There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own. ## Fundamentals This exercise covers the following fundamentals: 1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website. 2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules. 3. Using google fonts. 3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3. 4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins. 5. Overflow. 6. Using a simple form. This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning). ` --- ---This is the current exercise instructions: # `13` Check Your Postcard The last part will be our footer. What is the only element present in the footer? ![Postcard body content](../../assets/13.gif) ## üìù Instructions: 1. Create a ` ``` 2. Apply `text-align: center;` rule to the `.postcard-footer` class, that style will help align all of the `
` content to the center (the button will be centered). ```css .postcard-footer { text-align: x; } ``` 3. Apply a darker `background` and a `padding` to the button. ```css button { background-color: x; padding: x; } ``` ---
ai_interactions.ai_response:
What do you think the term "font style" encompasses? Is it just about the appearance of the text, or could it also include aspects like the font family, size, weight, and even the spacing? 

Consider the context of your postcard project. How might the choice of font style impact the overall feel and message of your postcard? What emotions or themes do you want to convey through your font selection?

ai_interactions.ai_response:
What do you think is the significance of choosing a specific font for your postcard? How might different fonts convey different emotions or messages? 

Consider the overall theme of your postcard. What kind of feeling do you want to evoke in the person receiving it? How could the font you choose enhance that feeling? 

Also, have you thought about where you might find fonts that align with your vision? What resources could you explore to find the perfect font for your design?
